reviews.review: Good, but I'd recommend buying the original Half Life instead if you want to play with mods.
Don't pre-order this game.
Когда-то Гейб выпускал вот такие хорошие игры, а не копии Counter-Strike.

-: bugy, UI, zmeny v dizajne niektorých lokácií, citlivejšie ovládanie oproti pôvodnej hre, občas problematický pohyb po rebríkoch

+: engine, audio, nové efekty, vyššie rozlíšenie, zábava, hracia doba, atmosféra, detailnejšie textúry a modely postáv, fyzikálny model, príbeh, zbrane, menu, vtipné bugy

Verdikt: Half-Life: Source je sporný HD remake pôvodného Half-Life. Hra beží na novom engine, ktorý poháňa aj HL2. Človek by si pomyslel, že autori sa chytia príležitosti a prekopú hru od základu, ale nestalo sa tak. Jedná sa naozaj o surový prechod do HD. Na textúry sa pozerá všeobecne lepšie ako aj na modely postáv a nové efekty, ale stále sa naskytá pocit, že tých zmien je jednoducho málo. Primárnou zmenou je vyššie rozlíšenie a možnosť hrať hru na širokouhlých obrazovkách. No nie všetky zmeny, ktoré obsahuje tento remake oproti pôvodnému dielu by sa dali hodnotiť kladne. Hra obsahuje množstvo bugov. Niektoré pobavia a niektoré dokážu strpčiť samotné hranie. Umelá inteligencia je miestami naozaj mizerná a až tragická. Doslova šokujúco pôsobia zmeny v dizajne niektorých lokácií, kde pôvodné textúry boli nahradené otrasnými 3D modelmi, ktoré anulujú atmosféru epických scén. Všeobecne možno povedať, že v jadre je to stále Half-Life, ale v tomto prevedení to jednoducho nie je to, čo mohlo alebo malo byť a jeho kúpa sa skôr vyplatí zberateľovi ako bežnému hráčovi.

Just buy the original. The source version has no good mods for it and the newer graphics in source are little different from the original. The only advantage of half life source is that you can add stuff to Garrys Mod with it.

It's hard to think of a bad Valve title, but when some can think of some Half-Life Source is mentioned.

Not because it was a dissapointment but because it was a horrible port. What I and many people didn't like about the source version was that, when we heard from Valve we were going to get a source remake of Half-life we though it was going to be amazing, although when HL:S was delivered it was just a source port. Although I would absolutely fine with this port if it wasn't for the bugs, glitches and gameplay.

Suprisingly Half-life Source has more bugs than the original game, and these bugs are awful almost breaking the experince. Even after the 10 years its been out, this game hasn't been fixed. Half-Life 1 is my favorite FPS game it topples everything in my opinion(even the sequels), and to be a port how can the gameplay be bad?

Well, since Half-life is running on a new engine the hit points and aiming is horrendous, for example the chopper: In the original game it took one or two hits to know the chopper down and a full charge from the tau cannon. However the the damage never seems to register properly so it makes the game unplayable. And it ruins the shooting with the new kick-backs of the weapons.

Half-Life: Source is an unpolished port and massive trump in valves libary of games.
But would I reccomend it?
Of course not, you should really just grab the original it has the single player campaign working flawlessly and a multiplayer that comes with it, unlike Source where you have to purchase it independently.

But if you feel like playing this game in the source engine and you think it looks good then I would say maybe get it.

Even though there is a source port for the original Half-life that looks superb.

6/10

No difference when compared to the original Half-Life. The only noticible new things are bugs and somewhat prettier water. That's it. Also half life mods wont support this, so you should get the original half life instead. You won't regret it.

In short, this is a nearly direct port. Buying this for Garry's Mod might not even be worth it if you want all of those models. Look out for a sale.

Literally greatest game ever

Half-Life: Source is the game that basically started my gaming addiction. Fun, complex, nerdy and serious game. A story about physics, aliens and corruption with a nerd hero. Easy puzzles like put A in B or just pull a lever located somewhere. You could find that graphics are old school and I wouldn't question that, in fact, Half-Life is old school. If you want to play for fun, go for Half-Life 2, if you want to play and inmerse in Half-Life universe, this game is the first step to take. There are no major differences between normal version and Source. It might use some graphics improvement but nothing more than that. Both are old style graphics; don't expect HD textures in here. Just enjoy your Half-Life trip!

A very good and original game, I can see how this game could've been so influential back in 1998 because of all the tiny details that you didn't get in a FPS game then, things such as interacting with your environment by means of pushing boxes and knocking out vent openings and leading guards and scientists to open doors for you, to name a couple of them. The game keeps you entertained throughout its duration and doesn't get boring once, you're either gunning your way through an area full of enemies or solving a puzzle to get through a different area and testing your resourcefulness and intelligence; the horror aspect is eerie and creepy without resorting to many jumpscares that today's "horror" games do so much of.

The game hasn't gotten old either, you can still play this game today nearly 20 years since its release and it will still deliver as enjoyable if you don't mind the old fashioned graphics and audio, of course!
This is interesting but a bit buggy.  I recommend but still prefer the original.

Good job valve keep it up! -

No matter how old the game may feel, the concepts and ideas brought to Half Life will always seem new to me. One moment your scattering for ammo while hitting headcrabs with your crowbar and the next literally running for your life against a Garganturae or fighting waves of marines as you uncover more about the aliens and where the come from. Is has that real variety that few shooters today have. However if I where to nit pick at something it would have to be a few of the Xen missions felt a bit off par with the other chapters and just seemed more like the scene from a movie you just want to skip and the platforming puzzles. This game could be considered as one of the most innovative FPS of all time for good reason. To be honest I don't think I can think of any other FPS games really like this. This is a classic... nuff said.

10/10

Dear valve, 
Please fix the issue where music starts playing, then the source engine decides to load a new section of the map 2 second later, stopping the music before you can even get into it. This issue really takes you out of the game, and its an issue with both the source versions of the originals, as well as 2 and its episodes [though thankfully not as badly - the most notable time being the Water Hazard mission, where again, the music barely starts playing before it is cut off by a load screen]. This is the best franchise in gaming history and I hate that this one little issue messes things up. =( Even though the graphics are slightly more dated, people are better off playing the original version of halflife, which is a sad thing to have to say.
-Faithfully, Concerned Citizen-

Buggy

Would I recommend Half-Life? Hell yes. Would I recommend Half-Life: Source? Er, maybe. The original Half-Life was, and still is, an absolutely fantastic game. The story and how it’s conveyed to the player works extremely well, and the controls, gameplay mechanics, visuals, and sound are all phenomenal. Very few bugs, and certainly none game-breakingly noteworthy.

However, this is where Half-Life: Source fails. This game’s major problem is its glitches and bugs. Some minor, some absolutely game-breaking. On one hand, you have scientist’s AI screwed up, running into open fire, constantly shooting off their response lines. On the other hand, you have some parts of the game where the textures and models go apeshit, essentially simulating your graphics card melting.

Even with the bugs, the game does try to make it up with some enhancements thanks to the Source engine. The water effects are slightly better (although in my experiences it’s just extraordinarily shiny and reflective), and the lighting effects are significantly improved, although inconsistent when walking into an area that needs to load. However, the HL2 bullet hole decals make it possible to create magnificent works of art with your crowbar on walls. 

Thankfully, the gameplay, controls, and overall look and appeal of the game is still there, unaltered. There’s no denying that the game is awesome. Half-Life in general is awesome. I just love how people on the GoldSrc version of Half-Life were complaining about the game having extremely old and outdated graphics, saying HL:Source is better in this field. Well, it’s not. A majority of textures and models are completely identical. Aside from the water and bullet decals, the games are visually the same, which is something I’m completely fine with. The regular version of Half-Life actually comes with the HD texture pack, something this port lacks. It essentially gives the game updated models to characters and weapons, and slightly enhanced textures in some areas. It’s nice, but not essential, which is fine.

Overall, yeah, go ahead and get it. If this is ever on sale for cheaper than the regular Half-Life, and you own neither, by all means, go ahead and get it. You (hopefully) won’t regret it.

I went into this having played hl2, but not the original. I was pleasantly surprised.

The story is a bit odd, but still quite good. Freeman just gets thrown in the deep end, which if you look at it from one of two perspectives either makes everything terrifying or hilarious. This also provides a bit more backstory to the universe, which is good.

A wide variety of weapons available. More so than hl2, I think, which is interesting and quite neat. It makes sense, given that this is set in a scietific research complex.

I had some trouble getting my xbox controller to work with this, but I think using a keyboard/mouse setup works better. There's no real need for a gamepad here.

Textures are about the right wuality for the age of the game. Not great by "today" standards, but still better than some games released about that time.

The soundtrack in this is really good, but the voices in the game can sound a bit garbled and echo-ey at times.

Despite the fact that this is a moderately old game, the source remake means that it has no compatibility issues with newer systems.

If you've never played the original half life, then definitely buy this game. If you've not played either half life or half life 2, I would reccomend looking for a bundle on steam to buy that contains all of them.
esse jogo é uma dlc sem fim e historia mais deliciosa ainda, o 'pai dos FPS's atuais'.

Je sors de ma grotte & je découvre half-life Source :  Half-life 1 refait avec le moteur source + pack de texture HD = ça se refuse pas.

Un fps culte, jamais ennuyant, jamais énervant, la campagne est classique mais efficace : il n'y a pas beaucoup de place à la narration (contrairement à HL2), tout dans le gameplay & l'excellente ambiance. Le jeux n'a pas veilli en terme de plaisir de jeux, ça se laisse parcourir avec plaisir.

Les packs de textures HD (via parametre du jeux, accompagné d'autres packs trouvables sur le net) limite le coté veillissant de l'ensemble.

Bref, un jeux à avoir dans sa biblio steam, tout simplement.

I feel ripped off.

I bought this classic during the summer sale in the hopes of getting the full half-life experience in slightly nicer graphics than the original. Valve published it, this is *the* valve brand, I bought it on steam and I expected it to work. I didn't even get to do any gameplay, before I was fuming. During the car ride in the beginning alone the game had to stop and load (!) four times! When I finally got out it had to load around every third corner. 

Don't make me laugh and say it's my rig. I live in the year 2014 and I expect a game from 1998 (or even 2004) to work properly and without loading every 30seconds!

Greatest PC game ever made IMO; organized and intricate level design, solid game engine, a wide variety of unforgettable enemies, smooth AI coding, refreshing arsenal that features conventional and unconventional weapons, and exciting and engaging music. Half Life bence gelmiş geçmiş en başarılı FPS oyunudur. Hatta FPS bile diyemiyorum, 3D Bilim Kurgu, keşif ve macera oyunu demek daha yerinde olur. Çünkü bu oyunu örneğin Max Payne den ayıran en önemli özellik, bence FPS nin S sinin Half Life için pek de geçerli olmayışındandır. Çünkü Half Life ta tam manasıyla karşına çıkanı öldüreceğin bir kurgu yok. Akıcı bir senaryonun, daha doğrusu bilimsel bir deneyin test aşamasında yaşanan aksilik sonucu paralel boyuta açılan kapıdan dünyaya gelen yaratıkların gizemini adım adım çözdüğümüz bir senaryo var. Bu senaryodaki rolümüzden bir tanesi de; evet, karşımıza çıkan yaratıkları öldürmektir. Ama tek amaç bu değildir. Sabaha kadar buraya yazı yazsam da, bu oyunu oynayıp edineceğiniz tecrübenin binde birini size veremem. Şiddetle tavsiye ederim.

PD: si queren revivir la historia del half life y no les alcanza para este juego les sugiero descargar el mod BMS ( black mesa source) :3 un buen mod y remake del half life 1 y es completamente gratuito :D

Half Life Source é uma atualização do HL original de 1998 feito sob uma engine aprimorada, mas se mantendo totalmente fiel ao que é apresentado no primeiro jogo. O jogo em si, inegavelmente é um dos mais influentes já lançados, vez que trouxe vários aspectos que foram se tornando comuns nos jogos a partir de então.

Um dos seus vários pontos fortes é a história cheia de mistérios e com um desfecho inesperado, mas, no entanto, o jogo não tem legendas e muitas vezes é meio difícil entender o que os personagens falam, já que o jogo é antigo, e a tecnologia nele aplicada também.

Uma coisa legal é que durante a jogatina, vira e mexe o jogo nos dá grandes sustos com aliens infames aparecendo do lugar mais improvável possível e bem na hora em que estamos mais entretidos na exploração ou à procura da solução de algum puzzle.

Os cenários são mais detalhados até do que alguns jogos dos dias de hoje. A variedade de armas também é muito grande, e algumas são bem curiosas. Um fato esquisito é que ao invés de apertar um botão para correr, apertamos pra andar, pois o personagem sempre corre por padrão rs!

Enfim, este é um jogo que pode ser considerado a frente de sua época. Claro que hoje em dia já se mudou muito dos princípios adotados em jogos antigos, como por exemplo, a dificuldade acentuada, mas mesmo assim é possível se surpreender com o que foi feito aqui tantos anos atrás. (MUITO BOM 8/10).
Просто супер. Шедевральная игра на шикарном движке
